info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 8:24AM CDT until July 23 at 11:15AM CDT by NWS Duluth MN
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues and has been observed on webcams and by Trained Spotters.
* WHERE...Northern Cass and Western Itasca Counties.
* WHEN...Until 1115 AM CDT Wednesday.
* IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 822 AM CDT Wednesday, trained weather spotters reported and webcams show urban and small stream flooding in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas and ponding on roadways have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grand Rapids, Walker, Cohasset, Coleraine, Deer River, Marcell, Bena, Federal Dam, Squaw Lake, Zemple, Boy River, Ball Club, Lake Winnibigoshish, Inger, Days High Landing, Schoolcraft State Park, Leech Lake, Pokegama Dam, Pokegama Lake and Gunn. - Ponding of water has been observed in the city of Grand Rapids and overflowing poor drainage areas have been reported by Trained Spotters in the Federal Dam area. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT THIS MORNING
